title: Puan Textiles
hero_image_alt: Woman weaving colorful Puan on a loin loom
short_description: The traditional skirt worn by Mizo women, woven on a loin loom with vibrant colors and bold stripes.
long_description:
Puan is the traditional attire of the Mizo people, a colorful skirt wrapped around the waist. It is woven by women on the 'loin loom' (backstrap loom). 

The Puanchei is the most colorful of the puans and is used on festive occasions. The intricate designs are woven with supplementary yarns. The patterns often reflect the tribe or village of the weaver.

major_centres.title: Aizawl
major_centres.summary: Thenzawl near Aizawl is the handloom hub.

authenticity_tips: Look for the tightness of the weave characteristic of loin looms.
seo_title: Puan Textiles: The Vibrant Weave of Mizoram
seo_description: Explore Puan, the traditional Mizo textile. Woven on loin looms with bold stripes and intricate geometric patterns.
